clinical_study.brief_title: Comparing 4L Golytely to 2L Golytely With 15mg Bisacodyl Regimens for Inpatient Colonic Preparation
clinical_study.official_title: 2L Golytely and Oral Bisacodyl 15 mg Versus 4L Golytely Regimen for Inpatient Colonoscopy Bowel Preparation: A Randomized, Non-Inferiority Open Trial

brief_summary.textblock: The investigators wish to compare the efficacy and patient tolerability of a preparation consisting of 2L Golytely (PEG + electrolytes) plus 15mg of bisacodyl vs the standard preparation of 4L Golytely. The investigators hypothesize that 2L Golytely with 15mg bisacodyl will show similar bowel cleansing efficacy while offering better tolerability.

primary_outcome.measure: Difference in Boston Bowel Preparation Scale & Ottawa Bowel Preparation Scale between the two groups
primary_outcome.description: These are established rating scales to evaluate the quality of bowel prep. The ratings will be compared between the two groups.

secondary_outcome.measure: Difference in the number of participants who develop distress symptoms from bowel prep (and the type) between the two groups
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants who develop distress symptoms from bowel prep, and the type of distress symptoms will be compared between the two groups

secondary_outcome.measure: Difference in the absolute number/percentage of participants in the two groups who find the bowel prep experience easy, acceptable, difficult, very difficult, or unable to complete.
secondary_outcome.description: Participants will be asked to rate their bowel prep experience (based on ease of use) on a Likert scale. The number of participants in each level will subsequently be quantified (n, %) and compared between the two groups.

arm_group.description: Subjects will be asked to take 2L Golytely + 15mg bisacodyl for bowel prep the day before colonoscopy.
Subject will receive standard bowel prep (4L Golytely) prior to colonoscopy.

intervention.description: Subjects will be asked to take 4L of Golytely the day prior to procedure.
Subjects will be asked to take 2L Golytely and 15mg bisacodyl the day prior to procedure.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Inpatients undergoing colonoscopy
- Age 19 or over
Exclusion Criteria:
- Unable to provide informed consent
- Patients with constipation
- Patients with suspected bowel obstruction or severe inflammatory bowel disease
- Same-day colonoscopy
- Intensive/critical care patient
- History of colorectal resection
